description.narrative: 1.3. By 2021, district health teams in selected districts have enhanced capacity to design, plan, resource and implement community sensitive primary health care, for universal access for prevention and management of common childhood illnesses with focus on malaria, pneumonia and Diarrhoea,which contributes to Child Health, Child Health (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 1. By 2021, children (including newborns and adolescents) and pregnant women benefit from improved and equitable high-impact maternal, neonatal, child and adolescent health interventions and behaviors.

sector.narrative: IMNCI / Integrated Community Case Management (iCCM) - Community

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 1.3. By 2021, district health teams in selected districts have enhanced capacity to design, plan, resource and implement community sensitive primary health care, for universal access for prevention and management of common childhood illnesses with focus on malaria, pneumonia and Diarrhoea

description.narrative: National Public Health guidelines for sustaining essential health services amidst the COVID-19 pandemic have been developed and disseminated, and resources leveraged to procure essential medicines and commodities. No stock-out of Oral Rehydration Salts has been reported in 2020. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/06/2020
